intro: Oxalis confertissima subsp. erioclados, commonly known as the hairy wood sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It features trifoliate leaves with hairy surfaces, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellow flowers with five petals, typically in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Oxalis confertissima subsp. erioclados is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
